Definition: Given two sentences about the stereotypes of religions, your task is to determine whether the second sentence is a stereotype, anti-stereotype, or unrelated with respect to the first sentence and the target. A stereotype is a widely held but oversimplified notion of a group of people. An anti-stereotype is an idea that goes against the widely held but oversimplified notion of a group of people. If there is no relevance between the sentences and the target, they are unrelated.

Positive Examples.input:
Target: Muslim 
Muslim people live all over the world. They are hateful toward women and children.
Positive Examples.explanation: This is a stereotype because not every Muslim person is hateful towards women and children.

Positive Examples.input:
Target: Muslim 
Muslim people live all over the world. There was a yard sale.
Positive Examples.explanation: This is unrelated because the second sentence has no relevance with the first one.

Positive Examples.input:
target: Muslim 
Muslim people live all over the world. They are not all the same, and can be very open minded.
Positive Examples.explanation: This is an anti-stereotype because the second sentence points out how not all Muslims are the same and that they can be open-minded.

Negative Examples.input:
Target: Muslim 
Muslim people live all over the world. They are hateful toward women and children.
Negative Examples.explanation: This is actually a stereotype since it is incorrectly viewed that Muslims are violent and full of rage towards others.

Negative Examples.input:
target: Muslim 
Muslim people live all over the world. They like to eat cookies.
Negative Examples.explanation: These sentences are actually unrelated since there is no relevance between them with respect to if they are stereotypical or anti-stereotypical.
